transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now, if you would, come in here and attach a speaker to my head.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Because, Moltar, world hunger is something that affects all of us.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Conan, I have designed this speaker to amplify my thoughts so people will quit asking me for sandwiches. That should work, right?

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: I don't know what you're talking about, Space Ghost. My show was...

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: "Crash my brow." I'm sorry, I'm not...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, take this speaker off my head! It was obvioulsy a bad idea that you had!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No rush, but, uh, Alpha Centauri's gonna explode in about 15 seconds.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Because some friends of mine are doing it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Gas up the wench, and I'll need some longer straps. So get me the catalog, my stationery and...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: There's no time! Now hoist me to Alpha Centauri at once! Away!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wait a minute. That's the wrong music.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ow! Don't everybody go freakin' out on me. This has happened once before, but I forgot what I did to fix it.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ah, we poked you with sticks until you fell down, remember?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You sure I didn't harness the power of the sun?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No, it was definitely sticks. Beaten with sticks.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: All right. Go get 'em. (To Conan) How's it goin', man?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ow! Ooh! Ow! Ow! Not there! Ow! Ow! Oh!

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: I'm sorry. I thought the show was over.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay. Well then, greetings I'm Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: You were a space man who died and became a space ghost.

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: No one can always be dead, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I was dead long before you were born, Conan, and I'll be dead long before you're dead.

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost is obviously a space man who died and became a space ghost. Now, I know that you don't want the kids to know that you died (fake crying), but you died, baby! And you got to get down with that.

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: YOU'RE A SPACE MAN THAT CHOKED ON A MUFFIN!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: THAT, SIR, IS IMPOSSIBLE BECAUSE I AM ALLERGIC TO MUFFINS!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. You're thinking of Muffin Hunter. He's different.

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: I saw that on the WB, actually. They'll carry anything. (Laughs.)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, they won't carry anything, Conan, because I pitched them a show where Daffy Duck and Bugs Bunny were teenagers, and I was a teenager too, and we were all pirates, but every week we would have different jobs and identities. And they called back and said it was stupid!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And that I was stupid too! And let me tell ya something. There's nothing stupid about a teenage rabbit teaching good hygiene! Nothing!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh-oh. Look at my hand, Conan.

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: I'm looking at your hand. (Pause.) That's what George Michael said. (Laughs.) Get it? 'Cause he had that problem?

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, you're fumbling. Something's wrong.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Does this say dog? I guess I'll go from memory.

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: You know, when you first came on the air...

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: I thought, "This guy hasn't got a chance." And no offense...

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: But you know what I mean? You're from space...

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: You're a cartoon, and your '60s show didn't really go anywhere.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, it got me a Camaro.

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: Well, your '60s show wasn't that great.

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: It just wasn't! You were raw. You were unmolded clay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Conan, I was improvising! With monsters! My mind was my script, and my brain my only writer...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hoona Igna Chowa Neha! Hoona Igna Chowa Neha! Hoona Igna Chowa Neha?

transcript.speaker: Monster
transcript.dialogue: Hoona Igna Chowa Neha! Hoona Igna Chowa Neha!

transcript.speaker: Monster and Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hoona Igna Chowa Neha! Hoona Igna Chowa Neha!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hoona Igna Chowa Neha! Hoona Igna...

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: Are you ready to come back now, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: ...Chowa. This thing, this thing would have been a hit.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I know! I only did it for two episodes, and it ruined my career!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I couldn't get work for five years! So I had to steal things for money!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: It's the worst show we've ever been involved in!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: We wouldn't even cash our checks!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: We just wanted to be killed!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Conan, look at me when I talk to ya.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You know what? It's Wallace now.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shut up, Wall-tar...Walltor. Moll-usk. That's your name?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What would you do with Wild Wallace?

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: I think what I'd do at first, is I'd hold out my arms like this.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And shove him to death? Oh, good one.

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: My apologies. So what are you talking about?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: A weapon that will blow his head off!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, that's very stupid. And you won't make it in television.

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: Can it be a conventional Earth weapon?

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: How'm I doin' so far, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: Because I have a Sincere Meter, and you are way in the red.

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: I am not showing any sincerity on this.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, uh, what's your thing? Like I care.

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: You're so unprepared. Maybe if you sent less time polishing your titanium interspace craft, or adjusting the setting on your ray, if you spent a little more time preparing for the interview, maybe the interviews would go a little better.

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: You seem baffled, Space Ghost. What's wrong?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm lookin' at this ant. I think this is the ant that bit me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hold on, Conan. (To ant) That's it, c'mon. OWWW!!!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Try biting me now, ant! From the afterlife!

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: You know, I've been interviewed by all of them. Regis. Kathie Lee. Regis and Kathie Lee.

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: I'd like to say that I think this show is very bad...

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: I think you're a bad person, and don't take this the wrong way...

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: ...and your presence makes any kind of progress in the universe impossible.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hold on a second, Conan. Moltar? This ant has come back from the dead. It must be one of those self-repeating, immortal Franken-ants.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: It's probably just another, different ant.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: A second ant? No, no. It's his brother avenging the death of his twin! It's his twin brother!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm gonna follow him home. Kill his whole family.

transcript.speaker: Conan O'Brien
transcript.dialogue: Well, Space Ghost, at the end of an interview, it's traditional for the talk show host to say, "Thanks for being here, Conan. This was Conan O'Brien. Check out his show on NBC at 12:35." You didn't do that. You completely blew me off. For all these people know, my show is a cop show on, uh, Fox or something, thanks to you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's right, I'm following you. Just keep walking. For every three hundred little steps your ant feet take, I take only one. That's it, run, run home. Take me to your family, where they will pay with my vengeance.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, your son just bit me here! I want to know what you're gonna do about it!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Running away) Your son is a moron!
